sources.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles (1939)
sources.description: On his uncle's death Sir Henry Baskerville returns from Canada to take charge of his ancestral hall on the desolate moors of Devonshire, and finds that Sherlock Holmes is there to investigate the local belief that his uncle was killed by a monster hound that has roamed the moors since 1650, and is likely to strike again at Sir Henry. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/the-hound-of-the-baskervilles-1939/

sources.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
sources.description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound, a beast that may be stalking a young heir on the fog-shrouded moorland that makes up his estate.

sources.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles (1939)
sources.description: The Hound of the Baskervilles (1939) is a gothic mystery film featuring Sherlock Holmes, played by Basil Rathbone, and Dr. Watson, portrayed by Nigel Bruce. The story revolves around a legendary demonic hound that is said to haunt the Baskerville family, leading Holmes and Watson to investigate the mysterious circumstances surrounding the heir, Sir Henry Baskerville.

metadata.Plot: On his uncle's death Sir Henry Baskerville returns from abroad and opens up the ancestral hall on the desolate moors of Devonshire. Holmes uncovers a plot to have Sir Henry murdered by a terrible trained hound.
metadata.Actors: Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce, Richard Greene
